question.body: Another change in the eye anatomy happens with age. Presbyopia is the loss of ability to accommodate for looking at near objects. Lenses can also be used to correct for this change. Which type of lens would be used in this case?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This would make the light rays diverge, making the image even more out of focus.

Correct. This lens will bend the rays before it reaches the cornea, bringing the image into focus on the retina; if they have other focus problems they may need bifocal lenses to adjust for both conditions.
